intro: Dichoropetalum palimbioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The flowers are typically bilaterally symmetrical, with two distinct lobes on the upper lip and three on the lower lip.
